October 23, 2011: Fiction
SHOCK WAVE, by John Sandford. (Putnam, $27.95.) Virgil Flowers investigates
several bombings of a superstore chain that seeks to open a store in a Minnesota
river town.
THE AFFAIR, by Lee Child. (Delacorte, $28.) For Jack Reacher, an elite military
police officer, it all started in 1997. A lonely railroad track. A crime scene. A cover-
up.
SURVIVORS, by James Wesley Rawles. (Atria, $24.) Individuals use survivalist
skills to defend themselves after the United States suffers a socioeconomic collapse.
NEVERWINTER, by R. A. Salvatore. (Wizards of the Coast, $27.95.) The second
book in a fantasy series featuring Drizzt Du‘Orden.
THE NIGHT CIRCUS, by Erin Morgenstern. (Doubleday, $26.95.) Two young rivals
at a magical circus become collaborators as they fall in love.
LETHAL, by Sandra Brown. (Grand Central, $26.99.) A woman, her daughter and a
man accused of murder evade the authorities as they search for her dead husband’s
secrets.
ALEPH, by Paulo Coelho. (Knopf, $24.95.) A crisis of faith is the impetus for a
journey through time and space, on a path that teaches love, forgiveness and
courage.
1225 CHRISTMAS TREE LANE, by Debbie Macomber. (Mira, $16.95.) Puppies and
an ex-husband loom large in the last installment of the Cedar Cove series.
A DANCE WITH DRAGONS, by George R. R. Martin. (Bantam, $35.) After a
colossal battle, the Seven Kingdoms face new threats; Book 5 of "A Song of Ice and
Fire."
FEAST DAY OF FOOLS, by James Lee Burke. (Simon & Schuster, $26.99.) Danger
increases tenfold as Sheriff Hackberry Holland investigates a case in the desert.
THE DOVEKEEPERS, by Alice Hoffman. (Scribner, $27.99.) The lives of four
women intersect during the siege of Masada in 70 A.D.
LIONHEART, by Sharon Kay Penman. (Marion Wood/Putnam, $28.95.) King
Richard fearlessly battles Saracens during the Third Crusade while back in England,
his brother plots against him.
SON OF STONE, by Stuart Woods. (Putnam, $26.95.) The New York lawyer Stone
Barrington gets to know his teenage son and proposes to the boy’s mother.
NEW YORK TO DALLAS, by J. D. Robb. (Putnam, $27.95.) An escaped child
molester pursues Lt. Eve Dallas; by Nora Roberts, writing pseudonymously.
October 23, 2011
Non-Fiction
KILLING LINCOLN, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The commentator
looks at the heart-stopping events surrounding the assassination of Abraham Lincoln.
BOOMERANG, by Michael Lewis. (Norton, $25.95.) A look at some of the places —
Greece, Ireland, Iceland — hardest hit by the financial collapse of 2008, and at how it
happened.
SERIOUSLY ... I'M KIDDING, by Ellen DeGeneres. (Grand Central, $26.99.) A
collection of humor pieces from the stand-up comedian and talk-show host.
THIS IS HERMAN CAIN!, by Herman Cain. (Threshold, $25.) The life and views of the
Republican presidential candidate and former C.E.O. of Godfather‘s Pizza.
JACQUELINE KENNEDY: HISTORIC CONVERSATIONS ON LIFE WITH JOHN F.
KENNEDY, . (Hyperion, $60.) Recordings and transcripts of a seven-part interview
with Arthur M. Schlesinger Jr. in 1964.
UNBROKEN, by Laura Hillenbrand. (Random House, $27.) An Olympic runner's story
of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
THAT USED TO BE US, by Thomas L. Friedman and Michael Mandelbaum. (Farrar,
Straus & Giroux, $28.) How America fell behind in the world it invented, and how it
can come back.
CONFIDENCE MEN, by Ron Suskind. (Harper/HarperCollins, $29.99.) President
Obama and his advisers, often at odds with one another, respond to the economic
crisis.
DESTINY OF THE REPUBLIC, by Candice Millard. (Doubleday, $28.95.) The life and
death by assassination (and medical malpractice) of President James A. Garfield.
A STOLEN LIFE, by Jaycee Dugard. (Simon & Schuster, $24.99.) A woman tells of
being kidnapped at the age of 11 and held prisoner for 18 years by a convicted rapist
and his wife.
RIN TIN TIN, by Susan Orlean. (Simon & Schuster, $26.99.) The German shepherd’s
journey from orphaned puppy to movie star and international celebrity.
IN THE GARDEN OF BEASTS, by Erik Larson. (Crown, $26.) William E. Dodd, the
U.S. ambassador to Germany, and his daughter, Martha, in 1930s Berlin.
THE SWERVE, by Stephen Greenblatt. (Norton, $26.95.) A Renaissance book hunter
rediscovered Lucretius’ classic “On the Nature of Things” and kept it from
disappearing.
SWEETNESS, by Jeff Pearlman. (Gotham, $30.) A portrait of the superstar running
back Walter Payton, who died in 1999.
